title: NEC Grounding Electrode Conductor (GEC) Sizing Calculator

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: For parallel ungrounded conductors of one phase, compute the equivalent circular mil area: $$A_{eq}=\sum_{i=1}^{n} A_i$$ Determine the minimum GEC size by locating the row in NEC Table 250.66 that matches your ungrounded conductor material and equivalent area. Conceptually: $$\text{GEC}_{Cu}=\begin{cases} 8\ \text{AWG}, & A_{eq}\le A_{Cu}(2\ \text{AWG})\\ 6\ \text{AWG}, & A_{Cu}(2\ \text{AWG})1{,}100{,}000 \end{cases}$$ Similarly for aluminum/copper-clad aluminum thresholds (1/0, 3/0, 4/0, 250 kcmil, 600 kcmil, 1000 kcmil, 1750 kcmil): $$\text{GEC}_{Al}=\{6,4,2,1,1/0,3/0,4/0,250\ \text{kcmil}\} \text{ per matching row.}$$ Electrode-specific caps are then applied: $$\text{Rod/Pipe/Plate}: \text{GEC}\le \begin{cases} 6\ \text{AWG Cu}\\ 4\ \text{AWG Al} \end{cases}\quad \text{CEE}: \text{GEC}\le 4\ \text{AWG Cu}\quad \text{Ring}: \text{GEC}\le 2\ \text{AWG Cu}.$$
